chapter.title: Phase Pre-Processing Results
chapter.para: Phase pre-processing is perfomed in baseline mode. The following table summarizes the processing results, as reported in the respective summary file.

Phase preprocessing is performed by means of program MAUPRP. Phase-only observables are analyzed, using the COMBINED strategy. Note that the RMS error of the epoch-difference solution should not be much larger than 2 cm. A short explanation is provided for the following columns:
'#SL' denotes the number of corrected cycle slips
'#DL' denotes the number of deleted points
'#MA' denotes the number of multiple ambiguities
'MAXL3' maximum residual for the ionosphere-free linear combination
'MIN. SLIP' smallest corrected cycle slip
